title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4038 - Claiming Races
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4038 - Claiming Races

State Regulations
§ 4038.1 - Who may make claim
§ 4038.2 - Minimum price for claim
§ 4038.3 - Conditions for starting claimed horse
§ 4038.4 - Sale, transfer restricted
§ 4038.5 - Requirements for claim; determination by stewards
§ 4038.6 - Opening of sealed claim
§ 4038.7 - Limitations on claims
§ 4038.8 - Person for whom horse runs
§ 4038.9 - Claim irrevocable when filed
§ 4038.10 - In case of dead heat
§ 4038.11 - Collusive claiming punished
§ 4038.12 - Effect of walking over
§ 4038.13 - Delivery on written order
§ 4038.14 - Refusal to deliver
§ 4038.15 - Intimidation, collusion
§ 4038.16 - Stewards' certificate to claim
§ 4038.17 - Horses claimed-testing
§ 4038.18 - Pregnant mare-disclosure prior to entry in a claiming race
§ 4038.19 - Certain voidable claims

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4038

Statutory authority: Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and

Breeding Law, §§ 101, 104[1], [19], 128, 207, 208, 227, 301, 305, 902; L. 1934, ch. 310, as amd

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
